sense.name: bring to equilibrium, keep from fluctuating
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 STABILIZE[transitive] NP2 Note: physical and metaphorical
sense.examples: He stabilized himself upon the ice for what seemed like a full minute. She stabilized her footing on the rocks. The drug stabilized her blood pressure. The law stabilized the price of palm oil. The economy stabilized after a period of inflation.

sense.name: achieve equilibrium, become level
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 STABILIZE[intransitive] Note: physical and metaphorical
sense.examples: As the speed of the airplane increased, the airplane stabilized. Company growth is stabilizing this year. The patient's condition has stabilized.
